Tom Emerson wrote:

> Trying to build CVS head with Maven 1.0.2 on JDK 1.5 under Solaris 10
> is giving me fits. I'll assume that others can build with Maven 1.0.2
> on JDK 1.5 on Linux and I'm on my own.
>
> For those who care, this is the error:
>
>
> arachnophobia (0)% maven dist
> __  __
> |  \/  |__ _Apache__ ___
> | |\/| / _` \ V / -_) ' \  ~ intelligent projects ~
> |_|  |_\__,_|\_/\___|_||_|  v. 1.0.2
>
> build:start:
>
> dist:build-setup:
>     [delete] Deleting directory 
> /disk2/heritrix/src/ArchiveOpenCrawler/target/distributions
>     [mkdir] Created dir: 
> /disk2/heritrix/src/ArchiveOpenCrawler/target/distributions
>
> xdoc:init:
>
> java:prepare-filesystem:
>
> java:compile:
>     [echo] Compiling to 
> /disk2/heritrix/src/ArchiveOpenCrawler/target/classes
>     [javac] Compiling 428 source files to 
> /disk2/heritrix/src/ArchiveOpenCrawler/target/classes
> /disk2/heritrix/src/ArchiveOpenCrawler/src/java/org/apache/commons/collections/map/AbstractReferenceMap.java:18: 
> cannot access java.io.IOException
> bad class file: 
> /usr/jdk/instances/jdk1.5.0/jre/lib/rt.jar(java/io/IOException.class)
> class file has wrong version 49.0, should be 48.0
> Please remove or make sure it appears in the correct subdirectory of 
> the classpath.
> import java.io.IOException;

The version complaint usually happens when you mix classfiles made with 
different versions of the jdk (1.4 vs. 1.5).  What happens if you do a 
'maven clean' and then 'maven dist'?  Do you have a 1.4.x JVM on the 
box?  What happens if you use that?  You can also just remove the 
directory src/java/org/apache/commons/collections/map and see if that'll 
get you further.  Its unused by current Heritrix (We should probably 
remove it completely).

St.Ack

>                ^
> 1 error
>
> BUILD FAILED
> File......

> Element... ant:javac
> Line...... 63
> Column.... 48
> Compile failed; see the compiler error output for details.
> Total time: 9 seconds
> Finished at: Sun Nov 06 13:10:30 EST 2005
>
> I'm a bit non--plussed by the class file version issue. Could my whole
> JDK installation be hosed?
>
> TIA for any pointers,
